column4: Hey, I'm running Feisty and getting lock-ups every single time I boot up on the login screen - this may be connected to the latest kernel updates. There's no issue with my hardware as I'm now running a Live CD and I have scanned the HDDs with fsck and badblocks. Is there anything else I can try to diagnose it with?
latest feisty updates worked here.  I gotta ask if you EVER used automatix or envy scripts... (Both bad ideas by the way)
Hmm. I MAY have used Automatix at some point to get some codecs. I actually can't remember, but probably.
And there falls another victim of automatix
Never needed Envy on Feisty, the Restricted Drivers seemed to work perfectly.
Yeah, I know, but ... well, mixed reviews, let's say. So, is there anything I can do about it?
Sorry, not much.  As the link says, best to reinstall..
Reinstall? Over my dead body, it took me so long to sort this lot out ...
Automatix seems to break many systems when they dont integrate with the updates
Is there anything else you think might be the problem? One thing I thought of is that I moved house yesterday, but I'm sure that can't be the problem!
Post your sources.list to the pastebin...
Yep.. you used automatix and that is the root of your problem and no we cant help you fix it.
Okay, many thanks. But you could help me: Other than my /home folder, what should I back-up to make transition as seamless as possible?
NOrmally I would say to burn /var/cache/apt/archives to a cd or use apt on cd, but there are going to be some files in there you do NOT want to use that were picked up by automatix
Thanks very much, Cap'n. Looks like I'll be back to Square One! No more Automatix for me.
I wish I had a better soultion, but at least we found the problem fast
